meanings.definition: Change in form, nature, or substance
meanings.sent1: The transmutes of the caterpillar into a butterfly is a beautiful transformation.
meanings.sent2: The transmutes of the seasons from summer to autumn bring cooler weather.
meanings.sent3: The transmutes of the cake batter in the oven made it rise and turn golden brown.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was a transmutes of colors and shapes, creating a mesmerizing masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The transmutes of the chrysalis into a butterfly symbolizes growth and change.

meanings.definition: Transform or convert into another form
meanings.sent1: He transmutes his ideas into captivating stories that entertain readers.
meanings.sent2: The wizard used his magic to transmutes the frog into a prince.
meanings.sent3: The chef transmutes simple ingredients into a gourmet meal that wows customers.
meanings.sent4: Music has the power to transmutes emotions, taking listeners on a journey.
meanings.sent5: The artist transmutes a blank canvas into a vibrant painting full of life.

meanings.definition: Alter or modify in appearance or character
meanings.sent1: She transmutes her hair color from blonde to brunette for a fresh look.
meanings.sent2: The tailor can transmutes a plain dress into a stunning gown with intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The comedian transmutes everyday situations into hilarious anecdotes that make people laugh.
meanings.sent4: Time can transmutes a shy child into a confident adult ready to take on the world.
meanings.sent5: The power of love can transmutes a person's outlook on life, bringing joy and positivity.
